instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: board is booting up but has no backlight.  tried with another screen (although i'm not sure if that was a known good) and still has no backlight.  <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> isn't short.  would appreciate some help on this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Get internal image, only missing baccklight?
Tested external video and USB activity?

Any history available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
not much history available, but board is clean.  this has been in my box of boards to fix when have free time(most likely customer wanted a board replacement).  Looks like <CAPACITOR>C9081</CAPACITOR> was shorted, because it was removed to probably get data.

internal image working. external image is working.  usb is working with external keyboard and mouse.

i saw some earlier posts that say to try and a dfu restore which i did along with a fresh install of sonoma and it still has no backlight.
getting 55v on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>
<DIODE>D8410</DIODE> - looks to be good
A-K not shorted
is the enable line suppose to have a diode measurement?  i'm getting OL on <SIGNAL>TP_LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL>...maybe this is the problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
55V is like open LED strips.
Test with known good LCD assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: i ordered a used lcd from ebay.  ill let you know.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Check continuity from <DIODE>D8410</DIODE> to J8500.
If good, save data and try DFU restore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: ended up being that stupid little lcd flex cable.
